history.text: Is anyone there?
Hey there.  Batman Begins has a pretty good ratings from different movie critics, because it follows comic book styles and real people at the same time.  Have you seen it?
No I cant say that I have seen it. Did you enjoy watching it?

Yes, I enjoyed it.  I thought it explored Batman's side as a human, not just a superhero.  It did a nice job of portraying the psychological issues he had as a person.  Christian Bale is a good actor in it
Sounds like a good one. I'm debating whether or not to see it.
I'm still not too smart with these types of movies. Would this be a Marvel or DC film and if I may ask, what's the difference?
This one is a DC movie.  It's directed by Christopher Nolan
It also has Liam Neeson, Gary Oldman, and Michael Caine in it
Do you usually follow movie ratings when you watch something new?
Oh yes, Liam Neeson. I know him, hes a good actor. Ive seen him in the Taken Series. Great character he plays and now recently in another suspense movie that takes place aboard a train.

However the other
 actors, I haven't heard of them.
I typically follow movie ratings when I go to the theater but not if I'm watching anything at home.
That makes sense.
It's funny, because Christian Bale manages to use some of his character from American Psycho, a completely different movie, in this one.
Oh wow. That sounds like you would had to have seen American Psycho to understand!
So how are the special effects in this Batman movie?
They're mostly practical and well done, as they portray the chaos caused by Scarecrow and the other bad guys of the film
I know you asked about it being DC or Marvel, but do you usually watch superhero movies or no?
I do, ive seen quiet a few of them but its all been in the last 4 to 5 years. I didn't grow up following these character via comic books or cartoons so I'm unfamiliar with their origins/affiliations.
Ah, gotcha.  I think it hits well for people that don't even usually like comic book movies.  Without spoiling it, it's partially a mafia drama in some parts, which is neat
It's also the origin story so it of course follows what made him turn into Batman from his childhood
oh ok.
So are there any major twist and turns, without giving too much away?
Yes, definitely.  It sets up some big twists that involve Bruce Wayne and the group he's trained with
.So would you classify this film as a block buster must have in your own collection?
Or is this one more like for the diehard Batman fan type?
I would say it's worth having even if you're not a major Batman fan.  Cinemascore even gave it an A which is pretty good
It has unique villains as well
I didn't expect the Scarecrow bad guy to be who he turned out to be when I watched it
Ahh! So there are some twist. I love twist and suspense.
Trying to figure out if I'm going to watch this film. What else is awesome about it?
The way they frame the supporting characters is really well done.  Michael Caine, who plays Alfred for example, really shines in the movie and helps Batman out a lot
It shows how Batman can't do it all on his own
That's been the story of Batmans life I suppose.
Yeah, I agree
Nice talking to you
Rich beyond measure, privlidged but scorned from the death of his parents. Having everything but having nothing at the same time. A loner if you will who is helped by his butler.

uid1response.feedback: I was trying to convince them to watch the movie using the document, without spoiling it too much.
